transcripts.text: I was listening to the police scanner on my app and I was watching live streaming happening on Facebook.  We saw the protesters turn and come this way, and the video we were watching was after the protesters had come by.  We could see that there was some damage.  The windows were broken.  It wasn't until after that that we realized that the building was on fire, and it wasn't just a few minutes after that.  The place was just a complete blaze.  This morning, get up, tried to get some rest.  This morning, get up, come down here, and what I see, I was not prepared for.  I knew it was going to be a disaster, but I didn't know what a disaster looked like until I saw it.
I can hear the emotion in what you're saying.  I mean, what is the family feeling right now?

It's tough.  You know, this is a business that my parents started 40 years ago, small, out of their garage.  It was a small business.  Did it just to make a few extra dollars, and eventually it grew.  31 years ago, they bought this building, and so we've been here ever since.  They're very upset about it.  It's emotionally... hurtful.  uh what we didn't do anything to anybody.

you know why did we deserve it unfortunately instead of taking time like insurance pays out but you still end up taking a loss somewhere along the line.  and it's not like our business was a million dollar business.  we operated locally we helped big companies and we do a lot of business but we weren't hitting rich, you know, being here.  So it's not like our checking account has a million dollars plus in it.
And what do you think about all this unrest and particularly the shooting that occurred that sort of sparked it?

Yeah, I think the unrest is not necessary.  shooting that sparked it, because I believe that was unnecessary.  I think I think we need to come together with a solution.  We got a problem.  We really need to come together with a solution.  I think destroying people's businesses, their livelihoods, that's not fixing anything.  If anything, I think that's silencing your voice.  Your people who protest and then the people who do the rioting, looting, you are silencing the protesters' voices.  You're erasing everything that they're about.
Sir, just my final question.  Do you have a message for your local leaders?  Anything at all you wanted to say?

Let's figure out how to bring some peace to this.  Nobody needs to suffer on both sides of the fence.  We need to be peace.  We all live together.  We need to work with each other.  If anybody's gonna grow and move forward, you need to do it together.
